revision.text:
An '''outlying territory''' or '''separate area''' is a state [[Territory (administrative division)|territory]] geographically separated from its parent territory and lies beyond [[Exclusive Economic Zone]] of its parent territory. The tables below are lists of outlying territories which are marked by distinct, non-[[contiguity|contiguous]] [[maritime boundary|maritime boundaries]] or land boundaries: ''TABLE Ia.Outlying geographical regions.'' {{clear}} {| width="100%" class="wikitable" !width="320px"| Outlying Territory !width="250px"| Parent Territory- State/Dependency ! Disputed outlying territories in the [[Spratly Islands]] are not included''. == See also == * [[List of sovereign states]] * [[List of dependent territories]] == External links == * [http://www.vliz.be/vmdcdata/marbound/query.php Maritime boundaries] * [http://www.seaaroundus.org/eez/eez.aspx Countries’ EEZ] *[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/outlying Wiktionary-outlying] * [http://www.icann.org/meetings/saopaulo/archbold-ccnso-sp-05dec06.pdf A European outlying territory] * [http://community.middlebury.edu/~scs/macand/index.htm Map of Spratly Islands] {{DEFAULTSORT:Outlying Territory}} [[Category:Borders]] [[Category:Dependent territories]] [[ko:격외영토]]
